subject: Leadership
title: Early Warning Signals
description: A fast breakdown of Early Warning Signals for builders.

hook.text: Before every disaster there were signs. Memos ignored. Metrics dismissed. Whispers silenced.

buildup.text: Weick found that most organizational failures are preceded by 'weak signals' that insiders rationalize away.

discovery.text: Weak signals include rising complaints, near-miss incidents, and staff turnover spikes in key areas.

twist.text: The problem isn't detection. It's attention. Busy leaders filter out noise and sometimes filter out the alarm.

climax.text: Build 'signal amplifiers': anonymous reporting channels, regular risk reviews, and a culture that rewards candor.

punchline.text: Warning signs always exist. The question is who's listening.

quiz.question: What is the main barrier to detecting early crisis signals?
options: Signals don't exist before a crisis
